name: Mango Rice
history: Mango Rice, also known as Mavinkayi Chitranna in Karnataka, is a traditional South Indian dish. It is especially popular in regions where mangoes are abundantly available. This dish combines the tanginess of raw mangoes with aromatic spices and rice.
description: Mango Rice is a vibrant and flavorful dish made with grated raw mangoes, rice, and a tempering of mustard seeds, chilies, and curry leaves. It's a delightful mix of sour, spicy, and savory flavors, often enjoyed during the mango season.

instructions.title: Cook Rice
instructions.description: Cook the rice until it's fluffy. Spread it on a plate to cool.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tempering
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, dry red chilies, green chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida, and peanuts. Fry until the dal turns golden.

instructions.title: Combine Rice with Mango
instructions.description: Add the grated mango to the pan and sautÃ© for a few minutes. Then mix in the cooked rice and salt, ensuring the rice is evenly coated.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Mango Rice hot or at room temperature. It pairs well with raita or papad.

tips: Choose firm and tangy raw mangoes for the best flavor.
Adjust the amount of green chilies to suit your spice preference.
variations: Add a pinch of turmeric for color.
Incorporate a small amount of grated coconut for a unique flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat gently in a microwave or on the stove with a little added water.

presentationTips: Garnish with a sprig of fresh coriander.
Serve in a colorful bowl to enhance the visual appeal.
